column4: My WLAN card was working until I installed network-manager. I can't connect to wireless networks any more (wired still works)
My WLAN card was working until I installed network-manager. Now I can't connect to wireless networks any more (wired still works). Is there anything I ought to do to get network-manger working?
Oh, I did the same message twice. Oops.
i guess u need to clean ur '/etc/network/interfaces'
Thanks, I'll have a look at that.
when u switch to network-manager, u hv to remove all 'wireless' related things from the 'interfaces' file
Ah, so that it can all be done dynamically, ok. Is # a comment in /etc/network/interfaces?
thanks, I think it's eth0 for me.
Ok, before it was showing me wireless networks now it doesn't do anything.
i've done this thing yesterday. wit, i try to figure out what i've done just after
i guess u need to kill NetworkManager
